name: Port Scan Nmap
description:
Scan ports to check for listening ports with Nmap.
Upon successful execution, sh will utilize nmap, telnet, and nc to contact a single or range of addresses on port 80 to determine if listening. Results will be via stdout.

steps.name: Check dependency 1/3
steps.description: Check if nmap command exists on the machine

data.command: if [ -x "$(command -v nmap)" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi;

steps.name: Resolve dependency 1/3
steps.description: Check if nmap command exists on the machine

data.command: (which yum && yum -y install epel-release nmap)||(which apt-get && DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y nmap)||(which pkg && pkg install -y nmap)

steps.name: Re-check dependency 1/3
steps.description: Check if nmap command exists on the machine

data.command: if [ -x "$(command -v nmap)" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi;

steps.name: Check dependency 2/3
steps.description: Check if nc command exists on the machine

data.command: if [ -x "$(command -v nc)" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi;

steps.name: Resolve dependency 2/3
steps.description: Check if nc command exists on the machine

data.command: (which yum && yum -y install epel-release nc)||(which apt-get && DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y netcat)||(which pkg && pkg install -y netcat)

steps.name: Re-check dependency 2/3
steps.description: Check if nc command exists on the machine

data.command: if [ -x "$(command -v nc)" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi;

steps.name: Check dependency 3/3
steps.description: Check if telnet command exists on the machine

data.command: if [ -x "$(command -v telnet)" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi;

steps.name: Resolve dependency 3/3
steps.description: Check if telnet command exists on the machine

data.command: (which yum && yum -y install epel-release telnet)||(which apt-get && DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y telnet)

steps.name: Re-check dependency 3/3
steps.description: Check if telnet command exists on the machine

data.command: if [ -x "$(command -v telnet)" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi;
